>
>
>
>
>
>
Electrical Safety Standards & Guidelines >Essential safety protocols for electrical engineering practice
>
Safety Symbols
>
High Voltage >
Ground >
PPE Required >
LOTO >Lock-out >
>
Voltage Classification & Safety Measures
>
ELV <50V AC <120V DC Extra Low Basic precautions
LV >50-1000V AC >120-1500V DC >Low Voltage >PPE required >
MV >1-35 kV >Distribution >Medium Voltage >Specialized training >
HV >>35 kV >Transmission >High Voltage >Expert only >
>
Personal Protective Equipment (PPE)
>
Hard Hat >
Safety Glasses >
Insulated Gloves >
Safety Shoes >
Arc Flash Suit >
>
Common Electrical Hazards
>
Electric Shock >" Current through body >" 1mA: Barely perceptible >" 10mA: Cannot let go >" 100mA: Fatal
>
>
>
>
Arc Flash >" Temperature: 35,000F >" Pressure wave >" Molten metal >" Toxic gases
>
>
>
>
Fire Hazard >" Overheating >" Short circuits >" Overloaded circuits >" Poor connections
>
>
>
>
>
Explosion Risk >" Hydrogen gas >" Battery rooms >" Flammable vapors >" Sparks ignition
>
>
>
>
Emergency Procedures
>
Electric Shock Response: >1. Do not touch the victim directly >2. Turn off power source immediately >3. Use non-conductive object to separate >4. Call emergency services (911) >5. Perform CPR if qualified
>Electrical Fire Response: >1. De-energize equipment if safe >2. Use Class C fire extinguisher >3. Never use water on live circuits >4. Evacuate area if necessary >5. Call fire department
>
Emergency Contacts >Emergency Services: 911 >Poison Control: 1-800-222-1222 >Electrical Emergency: Utility Company >Safety Officer: Internal Contact >First Aid: Trained Personnel >Maintenance: Technical Support >
>
Electrical Standards & Codes
>
NFPA 70E >Electrical Safety >in the Workplace >Arc Flash Protection
>
IEEE Standards >IEEE 1584: Arc Flash >IEEE 80: Grounding >IEEE 142: Grounding
>
OSHA 1910 >Subpart S: Electrical >Safety Requirements >Training Standards
>
NEC >National Electrical >Code (NFPA 70) >Installation Standards
>
IEC Standards >International >Electrotechnical >Commission
>
ISO 45001 >Occupational >Health & Safety >Management
>
Local Codes >Municipal >Regulations >Permit Requirements >
>
Pre-Work Safety Checklist
>
Identify all energy sources
> Lock-out/Tag-out procedures
> Test for zero energy state
> PPE inspection and selection >
Arc flash boundary analysis
> Ground fault protection verified
> Work permit obtained
> Emergency procedures reviewed >
Communication with team
> Tools and equipment inspected
> Weather conditions checked
> Training/qualifications current >
First aid kit accessible
> Fire extinguisher nearby
> Electrical drawings reviewed
> Safety observer assigned >
>
Always follow local regulations and company safety policies. When in doubt, consult with safety personnel.
